exam_stress_sos.name: Exam Stress SOS
exam_stress_sos.description: Quick 3-day plan to manage exam anxiety and build confidence

tasks.title: 4-7-8 Breathing Exercise
tasks.description: Practice 4-7-8 breathing for 5 minutes to calm your mind

tasks.title: Take a 10-minute break
tasks.description: Step away from your books, stretch, and have a healthy snack

tasks.title: Write 3 positive affirmations
tasks.description: Write statements like 'I am capable and prepared for my exams'

tasks.title: Create a study schedule
tasks.description: List subjects and allocate time for each topic

tasks.title: 5-minute mindfulness meditation
tasks.description: Focus on the present moment and let go of exam worries

tasks.title: Talk to a friend or family member
tasks.description: Share your feelings about exam stress

tasks.title: Quick review of key concepts
tasks.description: Spend 20 minutes reviewing important topics

tasks.title: Progressive muscle relaxation
tasks.description: Tense and relax different muscle groups for stress relief

tasks.title: Prepare for exam day
tasks.description: Pack your bag, set multiple alarms, plan your route

sleep_reset.name: Sleep Reset (7 Days)
sleep_reset.description: 7-day program to improve sleep quality and establish healthy sleep habits

tasks.title: No screens 1 hour before bed
tasks.description: Put away your phone, laptop, and TV

tasks.title: Drink warm milk or herbal tea
tasks.description: Have a relaxing drink before bedtime

tasks.title: Read a book for 20 minutes
tasks.description: Choose something light and enjoyable

tasks.title: Make your room completely dark
tasks.description: Use blackout curtains or eye mask

tasks.title: Set room temperature to 18-20Â°C
tasks.description: Cooler rooms promote better sleep

tasks.title: Ensure comfortable bedding
tasks.description: Check pillows, mattress, and sheets

tasks.title: Set consistent wake-up time
tasks.description: Wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends

tasks.title: Get morning sunlight exposure
tasks.description: Step outside or open curtains for 10-15 minutes

tasks.title: Light morning exercise
tasks.description: Go for a short walk or do stretching

tasks.title: No caffeine after 2 PM
tasks.description: Avoid coffee, tea, energy drinks in the afternoon

tasks.title: Eat light dinner 2-3 hours before bed
tasks.description: Avoid heavy, spicy, or fatty foods

tasks.title: Avoid alcohol before bedtime
tasks.description: Alcohol may help you fall asleep but reduces sleep quality

tasks.title: Write in a gratitude journal
tasks.description: Write 3 things you're grateful for

tasks.title: Gentle stretching or yoga
tasks.description: Do relaxing stretches before bed

tasks.title: Use calming scents
tasks.description: Try lavender essential oil or scented candles

tasks.title: Track your sleep patterns
tasks.description: Note what time you went to bed and woke up

tasks.title: Adjust your routine if needed
tasks.description: Make small changes based on what works for you

tasks.title: Try a new relaxation technique
tasks.description: Experiment with different methods to find what helps you

tasks.title: Review your sleep improvement
tasks.description: Note how you feel compared to Day 1

tasks.title: Create a long-term sleep plan
tasks.description: Choose 3-4 habits you want to maintain

tasks.title: Celebrate your progress
tasks.description: Reward yourself for completing the 7-day program

anxiety_grounding.name: Anxiety Grounding (5 Days)
anxiety_grounding.description: 5-day program to learn grounding techniques for managing anxiety

tasks.title: Name 5 things you can see
tasks.description: Look around and identify 5 objects in your environment

tasks.title: Name 4 things you can touch
tasks.description: Feel different textures around you

tasks.title: Name 3 things you can hear
tasks.description: Listen to sounds in your environment

tasks.title: Name 2 things you can smell
tasks.description: Identify scents around you

tasks.title: Name 1 thing you can taste
tasks.description: Focus on a taste sensation

tasks.title: Box Breathing (4-4-4-4)
tasks.description: Inhale for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4, hold for 4

tasks.title: Deep Belly Breathing
tasks.description: Place hand on belly, breathe deeply into your diaphragm

tasks.title: Counted Breaths
tasks.description: Count to 10 on inhale, 10 on exhale, repeat 5 times

tasks.title: Hold a comforting object
tasks.description: Hold something with a pleasant texture or temperature

tasks.title: Stomp your feet firmly
tasks.description: Feel the ground beneath you, release tension

tasks.title: Progressive muscle tension and release
tasks.description: Tense and relax different muscle groups

tasks.title: Category naming game
tasks.description: Name 10 items in a category (colors, animals, foods)

tasks.title: Recall a positive memory
tasks.description: Think of a happy memory in detail

tasks.title: Make a quick gratitude list
tasks.description: List 5 things you're grateful for right now

tasks.title: Combine 2-3 techniques
tasks.description: Use multiple grounding methods together

tasks.title: Create a personal anxiety plan
tasks.description: Choose your favorite techniques for future use

tasks.title: Practice in a low-stress situation
tasks.description: Use techniques proactively, not just during anxiety
